pull.title: rest: Expose block filters follow-ups
pull.body:
This PR addresses unresolved review comments from [#17631](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/17631).
This includes: 
* various style fix-ups
* returning a more verbose error message for invalid header counts
* removing superfluous rpc serializations flags for block filters
* improving the test to include comparing the block filters returned from the rest  with the ones returned from the `getblockfilter` RPC.

events.body:
Concept ACK. For reference, I've also opened https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/23599 to clean up the RPCTxSerializationFlags function.

I think the pull title and description can be modified to be self-contained. That is, following links is not needed to understand the changes.

issue.title: Expose block filters over REST
issue.body:
This adds a new rest endpoint:
/rest/blockfilter/filtertype/requesttype/blockhash (eg
/rest/blockfilter/basic/header/000000000019d6689c085ae165831e934ff763ae46a2a6c172b3f1b60a8ce26f.hex)
which exposes either the filter "header" or the filter data itself.
Most of the code is cribbed from the equivalent RPC.

You can test it at http://bitcoin-rest.bitcoin.ninja/rest//blockfilter/basic/header/000000005b7a58a939b2636f61fa4ddd62258c5fed57667a35d23f2334c4f86d.hex

events.message: [rest] add a more verbose error message for invalid header counts
[rest] drop superfluous rpc serializations flags for block filters
[test] compare filter and header with the result of the getblockfilter RPC

events.body:
tACK 4523d28b6bd550bf9f9c724f9aa90c3d2d4ebe3b

Style fix-ups and the new error message seem ok for me, I ran the test and it passed successfully.

ACK 4523d28b6bd550bf9f9c724f9aa90c3d2d4ebe3b

Thanks for picking this up!

comments.body:
first commit:

Changing the error message is a user-visible behavior change, not a refactor.

```suggestion
        CDataStream ssHeader{SER_NETWORK, PROTOCOL_VERSION};
```

Second commit: nit:

While touching this line, could use C++11 init?
I split this into a separate commit
